result.execSummary:
The defendant Renee C Pohle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 78 days credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, if revoked.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Concurrent with: any other probation sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to drive without a valid license.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1 of this Case.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Huber with standard release conditions - COMMENCING FORTHWITH.
After 30 days, defendant may be transferred to Day Report Program to serve out the balance of the sentence if she has been compliant with Huber.

AMENDED 09-16-2014:  After serving 30 days, defendant is allowed to be released to report on West Allis Warrant ($454 or 9 days HOC).  When completed with the West Allis Warrant of 9 days, defendant is to report to WCS - Day Report Center to serve out the balance of the sentence.

SECOND AMENDED 10-09-2014:  Court revokes Day Report Program and Huber sentence.  Defendant to serve balance of sentence as STRAIGHT TIME.  Defendant to get sentence credit from 08-14-2014 to 10-09-2014 (includes Day Report time).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Renee C Pohle in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.    
Victim notification has been complied with.

Defendant pleads Guilty to both count 1 (repeater enhancer is struck) and count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1 and strikes the repeater enhancer and count 3.
Count 2 is Dismissed as a Read-In.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
TOTAL PRISON TERM:       5.5 Years   
INITIAL CONFINEMENT:     2.5 Years
EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  3 Years
78 DAYS CREDIT (if revoked)
CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER PRISON SENTENCE (IF IMPOSED).
STAYED

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 Years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER PROBATION SENTENCE.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
Do not drive without a valid license,
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


FINE:  $ 268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DNA SAMPLE (if not already given) AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DRGOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation).

If revocated:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



COUNT:  3
4 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).
To be transferred to Huber - FORTHWITH.
After 30 days - defendant may be transferred to the Day Report Program to serve out the balance of the sentence, if she has been compliant with Huber.
